row.doc_headline: Ericsson, Argus Partner on Connected Car Security
row.doc_subhead: Ericsson, Argus, connected car, fleet, linux, android, QNX, cybersecurity, ECU, ADAS
row.doc_summary_med: Ericsson and Argus are pooling their expertise to offer security tools for connected cars over the course of the vehicle's lifespan.

row.doc_headline: Qualcomm Is Rallying Vendors to 5G Car-to-Car Networks
row.doc_subhead: Qualcomm, vehicle-to-vehicle, C-V2V, V2V, chipset, MWC, Mobile World Congress, NSRC, WLANp, Volkswagen
row.doc_summary_med: Qualcomm is looking to position its 9150 C-V2V chipset as a must-have for vehicle-to-vehicle communications. It's set to debut at Mobile World Congress this week.
row.doc_editor_bio:
Based on the Isle of Wight, a rocky outcrop off the English coast that is home only to a colony of technology journalists and several thousand puffins, Paul has worked as a copy editor and sometime writer since the age of William Caxton, covering the design industry, D-list celebs, tourism and much, much more.

During the nougthies he took time out from his page proofs and marker pens to run a small hotel with his other half in the wilds of Exmoor. There he developed a range of skills including carrying cooked breakfasts, lying to unwanted guests and stopping leaks with old towels.

Now back, slightly befuddled, in the world of online journalism, Paul is thoroughly engaged with the modern world, regularly firing up his VHS video recorder and sending text messages to strangers using a chipped Nokia feature phone.

row.doc_headline: Connected Cars Edging Toward '3rd Place'
row.doc_subhead: Connected Cars, Autonomous Vehicle, telematics, technology, IoT, Internet of Things, virtual reality, augmented reality, UX, Starbucks
row.doc_summary_med: For years, people had three connected places they could go: Their home, their office and their local coffee shop. Now, however, connected cars are looking to edge out bistros as the third place for people to connect with technology.

row.doc_summary_med: Bosch believes that ride-sharing applications will only become more popular in the coming years. Now it's buying Splitting Fares, a startup that wants to take your office to work.

row.doc_headline: Gallup: US Drivers Not Sold on Autonomous Vehicles
row.doc_subhead: Gallop, Autonomous, self-driving vehicles, US, drivers, Silicon Valley, self-driving trucks, college-educated,
row.doc_summary_med: A Gallup poll asked nearly 3,300 US adults their opinions about autonomous and self-driving vehicles. The results are in stark contrast to the enthusiasm coming out of Silicon Valley and Detroit.

row.doc_summary_med: Drivers across the globe are worried not only about on-the-road safety but also have concerns over who has access to their driving data, according to a new report.

row.doc_summary_med: The Volkswagen I.D. Vizzion is an all-electric, full-autonomous concept car that is designed for customers who can't drive and has a range of more than 400 miles.

row.doc_subhead: Uber, Uber Movement, San Francisco, Ride-Sharing, Boston, Washington DC, Cincinnati, Taxi, city planning, data
row.doc_summary_med: Although Uber has been at odds with municipal officials over its ride-sharing service, the company has now released its Movement app, which offers city planners a unique view of San Francisco and other metropolitan areas.

row.doc_headline: Connected Cars Make Drivers Feel Safer, but More Distracted
row.doc_subhead: Esurance, connected car, technology, drivers, GPS, smartphones, ADAS, distracted driving, insurance, safety
row.doc_summary_med: An Esurance survey of more than 1,000 US car owners finds that most aren't willing to turn over the wheel to self-driving vehicles right now. The report also notes that technology can make drivers feel safer, as well as distracted.

row.doc_headline: Uber Losing Billions as It Eyes Self-Driving Future
row.doc_subhead: Uber, Waymo, self-driving, autonomous, financials, Dara Khosrowshahi, Travis Kalanick
row.doc_summary_med: In an unusual move, Uber confirmed some of its internal financial figures this week, which showed the ride-sharing company lost $4.5 billion in 2017. The numbers also show how important self-driving vehicles are to its future.

row.doc_headline: Consumer Group Slams US Senate's Autonomous Vehicle Bill
row.doc_subhead: US Senate, Consumer Watchdog, autonomous vehicle, self-driving, Congress, AV START Act, California, Waymo, DOT, Safety
row.doc_summary_med: This week, Consumer Watchdog sent a letter to the US Senate arguing that self-driving and autonomous vehicles still lack significant safety features. The group noted the number of times actual human drivers had to take over when the vehicles didn't respond correctly.

row.doc_summary_med: Washington DC Mayor Muriel Bowser has created a new agency called the Interagency AV Working Group, which will help prepare the capital's streets for autonomous vehicles and self-driving cars.

row.doc_summary_med: Waymo and Uber have settled matters for now, but don't expect the harmony between the two Silicon Valley powerhouses to last for long, especially as the autonomous car market heats up.

row.doc_summary_med: The US Department of Transportation (DOT) is holding a summit on March 1 to gather feedback and outline its plans for an automated vehicle guidance paper.

row.doc_headline: PROMOTIONAL TERMS FOR THE CONNECTED CAR AMAZON CARD GIVEAWAY
Waymo Settles Patent Dispute for $245M Uber Stake
row.doc_subhead: Uber, Waymo, GOOG, Alphabet, Autonomous, self-driving, ride-sharing, Anthony Levandowski, Travis Kalanick, Dara Khosrowshahi
row.doc_summary_med: After a week of testimony at a federal courthouse in San Francisco, Waymo and Uber announced an agreement to settle their dispute, with Waymo taking a $245 million stake in Uber.

row.doc_headline: Embark's Autonomous Truck Completes Cross-Country Trek
row.doc_subhead: autonomous, truck, machine learning, Embark, Ryder, Electrolux, Level 2, Level 4, telematics
row.doc_summary_med: Relying entirely on sensor data and its on-board machine learning, San Francisco startup Embark's autonomous truck drives coast to coast in five days.

row.doc_headline: T-Mobile Provides Connectivity to Your Automobile
row.doc_subhead: T-Mobile, TU-Automotive, dongle, data, connectivity
row.doc_summary_short: Daniel Rockey, the senior manager for Product Management at T-Mobile, talked with Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell at the recent TU-Automotive Consumer Telematics Show 2018 in Las Vegas, to show how much data cars can collect and share with the owner.
row.doc_summary_long: Daniel Rockey, the senior manager for Product Management at T-Mobile, talked with Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell at the recent TU-Automotive Consumer Telematics Show 2018 in Las Vegas, to show how much data cars can collect and share with the owner. The company has developed a dongle that you can plug into the vehicle and pull diagnostics about the car that is then sent straight to the driver's smartphone.

row.doc_headline: Huawei, Telefonica Complete First V2X Tests
row.doc_subhead: Huawei, Telefonica, 5G, autonomous vehicles, connectivity, V2V, V2X, 3GPP, URLLC, proof-of-concept
row.doc_summary_med: Huawei and Telefonica have completed the first proof-of-concept testbed connecting assisted driving vehicles to a 5G-based, vehicle-to-infrastructure network.

row.doc_summary_med: Elon Musk is attempting a coast-to-coast trek for the company using Tesla's autonomous vehicle technology sometime in the next three to six months.

row.doc_headline: Waymo vs. Uber: How Potential Partnership Turned Into Rivalry
row.doc_subhead: Uber, GOOG, Waymo, Travis Kalanick, Larry Page, autonomous vehicles, ride-sharing, Lidar, Anthony Levandowski, Otto
row.doc_summary_med: During testimony this week, Uber founder Travis Kalanick claimed that he tried to start a partnership with Google's Waymo division, before the company hired its own engineers to start building autonomous vehicles. Here's how a potential deal turned sour in Silicon Valley.

row.doc_headline: Civil Maps Creates Brain Food for Autonomous Cars
row.doc_subhead: Connected car, Autonomous vehicle, maps, data, Civil Maps
row.doc_summary_short: As connected and autonomous vehicles start becoming more and more popular in cities, they need greater amounts of data to help navigate. This is where Civil Maps comes in.
row.doc_summary_long: As connected and autonomous vehicles start becoming more and more popular in cities, they need greater amounts of data to help navigate. This is where Civil Maps comes in. Vice President Vijay Viswanathan explains how the company is feeding maps and other location data into the brains of these autonomous vehicles.

row.doc_headline: Daimler & Bosch Will Test Self-Driving Taxi Within Months
row.doc_subhead: Daimler, Borsch, taxi, self-driving, Level 3, Level 4, Level 5, Mercedes-Benz, Germany, Waymo
row.doc_summary_med: Daimler and Borsch are teaming up to bring a self-driving taxi to Germany streets -- and the tests will start soon.

row.doc_subhead: Elon Musk, Tesla, Falcon Rocket, SpaceX, electric vehicle, TSLA, Starman, Roadster, Saturn V, Apollo
row.doc_summary_med: Elon Musk's own Tesla is taking a ride on the SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket.

row.doc_headline: ANALYST'S CORNER: Connected & Autonomous Cars Blog 4: Mapping & Harvesting the Benefits of Industry Intersections
Connected & Autonomous Cars Report 4: Mapping & Harvesting the Benefits of Industry Intersections
row.doc_summary_short: This is the last in a series of four reports discussing the dynamic connected car and autonomous vehicle industry. The intent of the previous three reports was to step back, and, as we transition from 2017 to 2018, take stock and freeze-frame the dynamics to provide a canvas for forward thinking.
row.doc_summary_med:
This is the last in a series of four reports discussing the dynamic connected car and autonomous vehicle industry. The intent of the previous three reports was to step back, and, as we transition from 2017 to 2018, take stock and freeze-frame the dynamics to provide a canvas for forward thinking.

This report attempts to put the automotive and telecoms industries in the context of the other factors impacting industries, as they transition from purely physical to cyber physical operations and solutions.

row.doc_headline: ANALYST'S CORNER: Connected & Autonomous Cars – Industry Overview One: Shifting Frontiers
row.doc_summary_short: This report looks at the factors causing a tectonic shift in the industry and how being blind to adjacent and shoulder technologies can be dangerous. This report will also address why pivoting to adjust to new global technologies is essential.
row.doc_summary_med:
This is the first of four analyst corner reports that will look at why the dynamics of the connected and autonomous car space are so fascinating, and how understanding the complex and interconnected technologies and trends can assist ecosystem players to be best positioned for future success.

This report looks at the factors causing a tectonic shift in the industry and how being blind to adjacent and shoulder technologies can be dangerous. This report will also address why pivoting to adjust to new global technologies is essential.

row.doc_headline: ANALYST'S CORNER: Connected & Autonomous Cars Report Two: Gradually Suddenly
row.doc_summary_short: This second report will discuss how the OEMS, ecosystem players and mobile operators should also be hyperaware of two other effects that will impact them and many other industries. The first is the “gradually suddenly” scenario, where combinations of gradually evolving technologies are suddenly having an exponential impact because of the addition of a simple catalyst technology.
row.doc_summary_med:
In the first report in this series, we examined factors of the tectonic shift occurring in the automotive industry and its frontiers, resulting in OEMs radically rethinking their business models.

This second report will discuss how the OEMS, ecosystem players and mobile operators should also be hyperaware of two other effects that will impact them and many other industries. The first is the “gradually suddenly” scenario, where combinations of gradually evolving technologies are suddenly having an exponential impact because of the addition of a simple catalyst technology. The second effect is the “adjacent possible” concept. Download this free report to learn more.

row.doc_headline: ANALYST'S CORNER: Connected & Autonomous Cars Report Three: Communications Fabric
row.doc_summary_short: This is the third report in a series of four that will look at the dynamics of the connected and autonomous car space. In this report we will link the concepts and impacts, highlighted in the two previous reports, to the communications fabric that has enabled the connected car of today.
row.doc_summary_med: This is the third report in a series of four that will look at the dynamics of the connected and autonomous car space. In this report we will link the concepts and impacts, highlighted in the two previous reports, to the communications fabric that has enabled the connected car of today. From the earliest car phones that had fixed-line style handsets and cradles, to Bluetooth-linked smartphones and modern 4G enabled in car WiFi hotspots, drivers as well as passengers have become increasingly connected. Download this report to learn more.

row.doc_headline: Nvidia & Continental Partner on Xavier-Based Vehicle Systems
row.doc_subhead: NVDA, Continental, Level 2, Level 5, AI, autonomous, GPU, CPU, Xavier, Lidar
row.doc_summary_med: The partnership could help give Continental a leg up as Nvidia powers ahead with plans to provide fully autonomous vehicle performance by 2021.

row.doc_summary_med: The long-awaited trial between Waymo and Uber opened Monday, with lawyers painting Travis Kalanick as a cheat. Attorneys for the ride-sharing leader countered, saying the Google-backed project was falling behind in its innovation.

row.doc_headline: How Connected Cars Are Helping to Drive Smart City Agendas
row.doc_subhead: Connected Cars, smart cities, AT&T, IoT
row.doc_summary_short: Connected cars are becoming more common, and these vehicles are considered integral to how smart cities grow and develop. Light Reading Senior Editor Mari Silbey recently spoke with Chris Penrose, senior vice president of IoT Solutions at AT&T Mobility, about connected cars and other smart city challenges.
row.doc_summary_long: Connected cars are becoming more common, and these vehicles are considered integral to how smart cities grow and develop. Light Reading Senior Editor Mari Silbey recently spoke with Chris Penrose, senior vice president of IoT Solutions at AT&T Mobility, about connected cars and other smart city challenges.

row.doc_summary_long: One of the hottest companies at this year's CES was Innoviz, which has been developing solid-state Lidar technology, and has earned the company accolades, as well as venture capital money and a lot interest from the auto sector. While in Las Vegas, CEO Omer Keilaf offered a demonstration of Innoviz's Lidar technology, as well as a look at the company's developments in artificial intelligence.

row.doc_headline: Creating a Common Language for Smart Cities
row.doc_subhead: IoT, Internet of Things, Smart Cities, Nevada, Las Vegas, lexicon, IT
row.doc_summary_short: Concepts such as the Internet of Things and smart cities are still relatively new. The challenge in southern Nevada, which includes Las Vegas, is getting elected officials, IT professionals and other stakeholders in these technologies to speak the same language and have a common lexicon.
row.doc_summary_long: Concepts such as the Internet of Things and smart cities are still relatively new. The challenge in southern Nevada, which includes Las Vegas, is getting elected officials, IT professionals and other stakeholders in these technologies to speak the same language and have a common lexicon, so that projects run smooth and issues such as data governance are dealt with in the proper fashion. It's a challenge for Tina Quigley, GM of the Regional Transportation Commission of Southern Nevada, who is overseeing several of these projects. She spoke to Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell at the TU-Automotive Consumer Telematics Show 2018 about ensuring that smart cities speak in one voice.

row.doc_headline: PPG & MCity Developing Special Coatings for Autonomous Vehicles
row.doc_subhead: PPG, MCity, auto paint, autonomous vehicle, self-driving car, driverless, University of Michigan
row.doc_summary_med: PPG will use the University of Michigan autonomous vehicle R&D facility to work on new paints that can be seen better by driverless cars.

row.doc_headline: How OEMs Can Monetize Vehicle Data
row.doc_subhead: Data, OEMs, Telematics, Wejo, Connected Cars, Autonomous Vehicles
row.doc_summary_short: With connected and autonomous vehicles collecting more and more data, OEMs are eager to start monetizing the information that is being collected, and build new services around it.
row.doc_summary_long: With connected and autonomous vehicles collecting more and more data, OEMs are eager to start monetizing the information that is being collected, and build new services around it. At the recent TU-Automotive Consumer Telematics Show 2018 in Las Vegas, Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell caught up with Steven Pimblett, COO and CDO of Wejo, to learn how OEMs are using the company's ADEPT data exchange platform to gain new insights, as well as build new businesses, from the data these vehicles are collecting.

row.doc_headline: Intel & Ericsson Are Tackling Big Data Issues in Connected Cars
row.doc_subhead: INTC, Ericsson, big data, connected cars, cloud computing, edge computing
row.doc_summary_short: Big data in connected cars requires big solutions. Here's what Intel and Ericsson are trying to solve.
row.doc_summary_long: Connected cars collect a lot of data. The problem is what to do with it. Caroline Chan, the vice president and general manager of Intel's Infrastructure Division, and Erik Ekudden, Group CTO at Ericsson, recently talked with Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell about how the two companies are looking to solve big data issues in the connected car world by leveraging cloud computing, as well as network edge capabilities.

row.doc_subhead: Baidu, Apollo, Udacity, self-driving cars, autonomous vehicles, driverless, nanodegree, engineer
row.doc_summary_med: Autonomous vehicle engineers can now earn 'nanodegrees' specific to Baidu's Apollo through Udacity.

row.doc_headline: How Harman Evolved From Audio to Automotive Deep Learning
row.doc_subhead: Harman, Samsung, Connected Car, blockchain, machine learning, security, cloud computing, deep learning
row.doc_summary_short: How Harman evolved from an audio technology manufacturer into connected cars.
row.doc_summary_long: Harman is historically known for its audio achievements, whether it's within car entertainment systems, professional setups or everyday consumer use. With the advancement of connected cars, however, Harman, along with its parent company Samsung, are expanding its technology offerings to include cloud computing, security, deep learning and blockchain that are specifically designed for the automotive industry.

row.doc_subhead: Renault, Mitsubishi, Nissan, autonomous vehicles, connected car, driverless, self-driving, Alliance Ventures, venture capital

row.doc_headline: Intel, Mobileye Will Use 2M Vehicles to Build HD Maps

row.doc_editor_bio:
Eryn Leavens, who joined Light Reading in January 2015, attended the School of the Art Institute of Chicago before earning her BA in creative writing and studio arts from Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass. She also completed UC Berkeley Extension's Professional Sequence in Editing.

She stumbled into tech copy editing after red-penning her way through several Bay Area book publishers, including Chronicle Books, Counterpoint Press/Soft Skull Press and Seal Press. She spends her free time lifting heavy things, growing her own food, animal wrangling and throwing bowls on the pottery wheel. She lives in Alameda, Calif., with two cats and two greyhounds.

row.doc_headline: ARM Providing Security for Smart Cars
row.doc_subhead: ARM, IoT, Security, Connected Car, Autonomous Vehicle, CES 2018
row.doc_summary_short: ARM is applying security lessons from IoT to connected cars.
row.doc_summary_long: Over the last several years, ARM has been developing security within IoT devices. John Ronco, the vice president of product marketing at ARM, talked to Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell at this month's CES expo to explain how the same security measures in IoT devices apply to connected and autonomous vehicles, and how machine learning is one of the company's main security innovations that is driving much of this innovation.

row.doc_headline: 5G Will Create Cloud of Connected Vehicles
row.doc_subhead: 3GPP, Connected Car, 5G, Connectivity, LTE, V2X, GSMA, 5GPPP, Security, V2V
row.doc_summary_med: As the 3GPP has approved the first standard for 5Gnetworks, new V2V and V2X technologies will be available this year, including on-the-fly, cloud connectivity.
row.doc_editor_bio:
Eryn Leavens, who joined Light Reading in January 2015, attended the School of the Art Institute of Chicago before earning her BA in creative writing and studio arts from Hampshire College in Amherst, Mass. She also completed UC Berkeley Extension's Professional Sequence in Editing.

She stumbled into tech copy editing after red-penning her way through several Bay Area book publishers, including Chronicle Books, Counterpoint Press/Soft Skull Press and Seal Press. She spends her free time lifting heavy things, growing her own food, animal wrangling and throwing bowls on the pottery wheel. She lives in Alameda, Calif., with two cats and two greyhounds.

row.doc_headline: Ford Expands Autonomous Delivery Plans With Postmates Deal
row.doc_subhead: Ford, Jim Hackett, Sherif Markaby, Postmates, autonomous vehicles, driverless, self-driving, delivery
row.doc_summary_med: Ford now has driverless partnerships with Postmates, Domino's and Lyft.

row.doc_headline: Cisco & Hyundai Look to Build a Next-Generation Car Platform
row.doc_subhead: CSCO, Hyundai, Connected Car, Ethernet, CES 2018, harness, IoT, sensors
row.doc_summary_short: At CES 2018 in Las Vegas earlier this month, Cisco and Hyundai announced a new partnership that will focus on simplifying the connected car process.
row.doc_summary_long: At CES 2018 in Las Vegas earlier this month, Cisco and Hyundai announced a new partnership that will focus on simplifying the connected car process. To find out what the two companies are up to in the connected car market, Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell spoke with Ruba Borno, Cisco's vice president of Growth Initiatives and chief of staff to the CEO, about how the two companies are moving from legacy harness to automotive Ethernet, and how this process will help car companies innovate faster while delivering more seamless functionality. Bell also caught up with James Peters, the vice president of IoT Automotive, Connected Car, at Cisco, to learn about the latest in Ethernet switch and in-vehicle networking developments.

row.doc_summary_med: Samsung and Harman showed their new cockpit, telematics and DRVLINE autonomous platform at CES.

row.doc_summary_short: At CES in Las Vegas, Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell is on the lookout for the biggest developments in artificial intelligence, 5G and smart cities technologies, and how these will be incorporated within autonomous vehicles.
row.doc_summary_long: At CES in Las Vegas, Heavy Reading analyst Steve Bell is on the lookout for the biggest developments in artificial intelligence, 5G and smart cities technologies, and how these will be incorporated within autonomous vehicles. This year, the north hall of the Las Vegas Convention Center looks more like a car show than a technology event. It's also where Nvidia revealed how the company's powerful GPUs are making it all possible.

row.doc_headline: Apple Patent Hints at Autonomous Vehicle Plans
row.doc_subhead: Apple, autonomous vehicles, self-driving car, navigation system, patent application
row.doc_summary_med: The patent application for 'Autonomous Navigation System' shows what Apple has been working on.
